content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-265-07-A |Item_parent=Urinary lithiasis |Item_parent_short=Urinary lithiasis |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the clinical aspects of simple renal colic |Description=Pain, radiation, nausea... |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Romain Boissier |Order=7}} Renal colic is said to be "simple" when it occurs : * without fever or chills, * no biological renal failure or oligo-anuria * and that it subsides with analgesic treatment with NSAIDs.

question.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of simple renal colic?
question.option_d: Pain that radiates to the lower abdomen
